episodes.content: From concert halls and theaters to clubs and restaurants, many venues shutdown under the pandemic, depriving musicians and fans of the magic live music brings. But despite the lockdown, world-famous cellist Yo-Yo Ma picked up his instrument and began to play, sharing music remotely from his home to the world. Soon #SongsOfComfort became viral, providing a platform for artists, professionals or amateurs to express themselves. We asked Yo-Yo how music can help comfort us in these challenging times.
episodes.description: An experienced anchor Del Irani has a cutting-edge dialogue. A world-famous cellist Yo-Yo Ma performed live at home to share his creation online. We asked him how music can help people amid pandemic.
episodes.subtitle: How Music Can Give Comfort During the Pandemic: Yo-Yo Ma / Cellist
episodes.title: DEEPER LOOK from New York

episodes.content: The US presidential election and the chaotic aftermath have shown how deeply divided the country has been. And it looks like it will take a long time to fill the ditch. Yo-Yo Ma was born in France and immigrated to the U.S. in his childhood. He has played for successive presidents and seen the transition in the country. Our host, Del Irani, asked Yo-Yo Ma how he sees America. How can he find hope in the U.S.? And what role music can play.
episodes.description: An experienced anchor Del Irani has a cutting-edge dialogue. She asks Yo-Yo Ma, a world-famous cellist, how he sees America today which is deepley divided and how he can find hope with music.
episodes.subtitle: How Has America Changed?: Yo-Yo Ma / Cellist
episodes.title: DEEPER LOOK from New York
